ngiemboon: Táʼ, á gwɔ́ na mbɔ́ɔntè saŋ sɔɔnmbʉ́a na ngùʼu láʼ, Esemayɛ̂ɛ gẅie aa míŋ Netania wembàŋa, ńgwɔ́ míŋ míŋ Elishÿama, á tóo Misepa ńgyá Ngendalia, míŋ Ayikam wembàŋa. Esemayɛ̂ɛ laa nyìŋ ńkẅɛɛ na tsìŋendá nɔʼ, mbà à laa tsɔ̌ tàʼ ngàŋafàʼ lÿò na megàŋafàʼ fùɔ. À la gwaa gʉa mbʉ̀a Ngendalia, pâ mbàŋa legém gwɔ́; ńkúu wó, pâ pɔ̌ pú ńne ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó.
en: In the seventh month, Ishmael son of Nethaniah, son of Elishama, of the royal family and one of the king’s chief officers, came with ten men to Gedaliah son of Ahikam at Mizpah. They ate a meal together there in Mizpah,

ngiemboon: Esemayɛ̂ɛ míŋ Netania wembàŋa leen ńgwóon ńdɔg mbàŋa yé ŋwɛ́ legém ńdu ssé, ńdɔg nně ncù ésɔbɔ Ngendalia míŋ Ayikam wembàŋa gẅie aa míŋ Shÿafaŋ. Wɔɔn aa páʼ pɔ́ la zẅé nyìŋ gẅie fùɔ Mbambilonia la lɔgɔ yé ńgÿo ngúmnɔ̀ɔn ngwòŋ Yúndà púʼu.
en: but then Ishmael son of Nethaniah and the ten men who were with him got up and struck down Gedaliah son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, with the sword; he killed the one the king of Babylon had appointed in the land.

ngiemboon: Esemayɛ̂ɛ la gíŋe ḿbú ńzẅéte pʉ̀a Yúndà pie pâ Ngendalia laa Misepa, ńgíŋe ńzẅéte mbɔɔ palÿɔ́ʼncù pe Mbambilonia pie é laa yɔ́b jʉʼó.
en: Ishmael also struck down all the Judeans who were with Gedaliah at Mizpah, as well as the Chaldean soldiers who were there.

ngiemboon: Mé la zẅé Ngendalia tà é tɔ́g lyɛ̌ʼ pʉ́a, à lagá nyìŋ ké ńnyé pɔ́ te zsě ngie Ngendalia kwě,
en: On the day after he had killed Gedaliah, when no one knew yet,

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a móm lefɔ̌ɔn fó Sishÿɛ̂m, mbɔɔ Shʉlo, lâ Samalîɛ, ńtó, melÿò mɔ́b gwɔ́ mé nkwǒon, pɔ́ maʼ meshʉate menzsǒ, mbùm yɔb gwɔ́ ye ngwate; pɔ́ tó púʼu, ńgẅiin shúm pwɔʼ sie mé lagá nkáʼ, ńgÿo lìi, é sie pɔ́ ge náa tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á Yelúzálèm.
en: eighty men came from Shechem, Shiloh,   and Samaria  # 41:5 1Kg 16:24 who had shaved their beards,  # 41:5 Dt 14:1 torn their clothes, and gashed themselves, and  # 41:5 Lv 19:27–28; 21:5 who were carrying grain and incense offerings to bring to the temple of the Lord.  # 41:5 2Kg 25:9

ngiemboon: Esemayɛ̂ɛ gẅie aa míŋ Netania wembàŋa, fó Misepa, ńgwaa gʉa lékẅɛ́te pʉ̀a móm lefɔ̌ɔn ŋwɛ́, ńgiŋe ńdʉa. Ńgʉa tà ńkẅɛ́te wɔ́b, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi tó lé mbʉ̀a Ngendalia míŋ Ayikam wembàŋa.
en: Ishmael son of Nethaniah came out of Mizpah to meet them, weeping as he came. When he encountered them, he said, “Come to Gedaliah son of Ahikam! ”

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pâ pɔ̌ gʉa tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ, Esemayɛ̂ɛ, míŋ Netania wembàŋa zẅéte wɔ́b ḿmaʼ mepfó mɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ tâŋ ntse.
en: But when they came into the city, Ishmael son of Nethaniah and the men with him slaughtered them and threw them into   a cistern.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a legém na pʉ̀a móm lefɔ̌ɔn ŋwɛ́ la gɔɔn né Esemayɛ̂ɛ ngie: «Te zẅé wég, á nue peg gẅiin shúm sie peg ně ńtsẅág ńdeʼe mbàʼ: é ngesáŋ ntsíŋ, mbɔɔ gie mé tóŋo lê ɔ̂ɔjÿè, é mevɛ́, mbɔɔ melwòŋwáʼ.» Esemayɛ̂ɛ júʼ púʼu, à te zẅé pɔɔn pʉ̀a legém páʼ à zɔ̌ɔn ńzẅé mefɛ̌ pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: However, there were ten men among them who said to Ishmael, “Don’t kill us, for we have hidden treasure in the field #— #wheat, barley, oil, and honey! ” So he stopped and did not kill them along with their companions.

ngiemboon: Atɔ́ɔn ntse gie Esemayɛ̂ɛ míŋ Netania wembàŋa lɔ̌ɔn ḿmaʼa mepfó pʉ̀a pie à zẅeté, á tsoló, á laa tɔ́ɔn gie fùɔ Asa la gÿo mé túŋ, á fʉ̀ʼ gie pɔ́ Mbashÿa gẅie aa laa fùɔ pa Ésàlayɛ la ne ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ ncù, à tɔ́ɔn ŋwɛ́ la gáʼ tɛʼ, Esemayɛ̂ɛ ké ńdɔg pɔ́ mepfó pʉ̀a pie à zẅeté, ńdẅíŋe.
en: Now the cistern where Ishmael had thrown all the corpses of the men he had struck down was a large one   that King Asa had made in the encounter with King Baasha of Israel.  # 41:9 1Kg 15:16–22 Ishmael son of Nethaniah filled it with the slain.

ngiemboon: Esemayɛ̂ɛ la gÿo púʼu, ńdɔgɔ pfwɔ̀ʼɔ pʉ̀a pie é la nyé ńgwɔ́ Misepa ńgÿo ngàŋatsǎŋ ncù, é púɔ ntɔ́ʼ pepanzwě, mbɔɔ pʉ̀a metsèm pie é la nyé wó, ńgwɔ́ pie Nembuzalandaŋ gẅie à tyé twómvfò na papyɛ́b jʉʼ la cʉ́me mbwó Ngendalia míŋ Ayikam wembàŋa. Pɔ́ la cʉ́ʼ megàŋatsǎŋ ncù púʼu, Esemayɛ̂ɛ míŋ Netania wembàŋa lɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgʉa né tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ pʉ̀a Amoŋ.
en: Then Ishmael took captive all the rest of the people of Mizpah including the daughters of the king #— #all those who remained in Mizpah over whom Nebuzaradan, captain of the guards, had appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam. Ishmael son of Nethaniah took them captive and set off to cross over to the Ammonites.

ngiemboon: Yoyanaŋ míŋ Kaleya wembàŋa pâ metándá menùɔ palÿɔ́ʼncù pie pâ pɔ̌ la gwɔ́, é júʼ menò tepòŋ ntsèm mie Esemayɛ̂ɛ míŋ Netania wembàŋa fʉ̌ʼ,
en: When Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the armies   with him heard of all the evil that Ishmael son of Nethaniah had done,

ngiemboon: ḿbú ńcúʼte mbàŋa ntsèm, lélɔg ńgʉa ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ Esemayɛ̂ɛ míŋ Netania wembàŋa lé ncù. Pɔ́ la faʼa yé tà keme yé ngʉ̀ŋe máa zème ntse gie áa Ngambahoŋ.
en: they took all their men and went to fight with Ishmael son of Nethaniah. They found him by the great pool in Gibeon.

ngiemboon: Megàŋatsǎŋ ncù pie Esemayɛ̂ɛ míŋ Netania wembàŋa la ne ńdɔgɔ ńgee, é la gwɔ́ tà ńgyá Yoyanaŋ míŋ Kaleya pâ metándá menùɔ palÿɔ́ʼncù, ḿbú ńkág.
en: When all the people held by Ishmael saw Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the army with him, they rejoiced.

ngiemboon: Á la cʉa púʼu, epʉ̀a metsèm pie Esemayɛ̂ɛ la lɔg fó Misepa ńgʉa, é sele nnɛ́ ḿbiŋ nzèm, ńgʉa ńtemte na Yoyanaŋ míŋ Kaleya.
en: All the people whom Ishmael had taken captive from Mizpah turned around and rejoined Johanan son of Kareah.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Esemayɛ̂ɛ míŋ Netania wembàŋa lɔg pʉ̀a lefɔ̌ɔn, éfó lejʉ́ŋ Yoyanaŋ míŋ Kaleya wembàŋa, ńkÿo ńgʉa né ngwòŋ pʉ̀a Amoŋ.
en: But Ishmael son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight men and went to the Ammonites.

ngiemboon: Esemayɛ̂ɛ míŋ Netania wembàŋa la kÿo ńgʉa púʼu, Yoyanaŋ míŋ Kaleya wembàŋa, pâ metándá menùɔ palÿɔ́ʼncù pie pâ pɔ̌ la gwɔ́, é pú ńcúʼte pfwɔ̀ʼɔ pʉ̀a pie é la tsɔgɔ, à na kwò pʉ̀a pie Esemayɛ̂ɛ la lɔg fó Misepa ńtó, páʼ mé la zẅé Ngendalia míŋ Ayikam wembàŋa. Á laa nùɔ pɔ́b, pɔɔn gwɔ́ metándá palÿɔ́ʼncù, pâ palÿɔ́ʼncù; pɔɔn gwɔ́ panzwě pâ gubé; pɔɔn gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie mé la shʉ́ʉ wɔ́b, ńgÿo patyé twómvfò na palÿɔ́ʼncù pie à la lɔgɔ wɔ́b éfó Ngambahoŋ ńtó.
en: Johanan son of Kareah and all the commanders of the armies with him then took from Mizpah all the remnant of the people whom he had recovered from Ishmael son of Nethaniah after Ishmael had killed Gedaliah son of Ahikam #— #men, soldiers, women, children, and court officials whom he brought back from Gibeon.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gʉa tà ńkúu ndá megʉ̀ gie ee Kiyam, lékúu Mbɛ́tèlehɛm, ńtyé. Pɔ́ la ne faʼa légʉa tà ńkúu ngwòŋ Egíbtò.
en: They left, stopping in Geruth Chimham,   which is near Bethlehem, in order to make their way into Egypt,

ngiemboon: Ńgee púʼu, ńtí nue pɔ́ ée ńcʉ́ʼʉ ḿbɔ́gɔ pʉ̀a Mbambilonia pɔ̌g tà fó fʉ̀ʼ gie Esemayɛ̂ɛ la zẅé Ngendalia gẅie à laa míŋ Ayikam, ńgwɔ́ ngúmnɔ̀ɔn gẅie fùɔ Mbambilonia la néŋe tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Yúndà.
en: away from the Chaldeans. For they feared them because Ishmael son of Nethaniah had struck down Gedaliah son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon had appointed over the land.
